definitions.definition: to quickly take something in your hand(s) and hold it firmly:
If you grasp an opportunity, you take it eagerly:
examples: We must grasp every opportunity to strengthen economic ties with other countries.

definitions.definition: the act of holding onto someone or something:
examples: He shook my hand with a very firm grasp.

definitions.definition: the ability to get, achieve, or keep something:
examples: The presidency at last looked within her grasp (= it looked possible that she might become president).
